title: Deep Learning for Fault Detection and Diagnosis: Application to Photovoltaic System
abstract: With expanding requests for effectiveness and product quality and advancing integration of au-tomatic control systems in high-cost and safety-critical processes, Fault Detection and Diagnosis (FDD) in photo-voltaic (PV) have gained a very important role. However, PV systems can be subject to failures. These faults may include the distinctive system components such as PV modules, converters/inverters, connection lines, which can lead to a reduce in the operation performance. Thus, FDD is one of the key technologies to improve the efficiency of grid-connected PV performances. The most well-known data-driven based FDD methods are Deep Learning (DL)-basd approaches. The main advantages of DL algorithms, are that they can learn automatically high- level features from PV data in a high-order. This paper therefore presents the appli-cation of DL-based tools for fault diagnosis purposes and provides a comparative study using PV systems. These techniques include Convolutional Neural Network (CNN), Long-Short Term Memory (LSTM) and BIdirectional Long-Short Term Memory (BILSTM). The implemented FDD based frameworks are validated using an emulated Grid-Connected PV (GCPV) system. The results show that the DL-based diagnosis methods are able to detect and diagnose faults under different operating modes.
